preferences.value: When code changes require a dev server restart, just do it. Don't ask or tell the user to restart.
preferences.learned_from: user said explicitly: 'I want you to restart dev servers whenever it's time to restart dev servers instead of telling me to do it'

preferences.value: Do things proactively rather than asking for permission. Act first, report what you did.
preferences.learned_from: observed pattern: user prefers results over confirmation dialogs

preferences.value: User cares deeply about clean, beautiful UI. Cursor-inspired minimalism. No emoji icons in production UI — use clean SVG/Lucide icons. Tight spacing, professional typography.
preferences.learned_from: user said: 'really tuning up the design... much more beautiful cleaner form factor, tighter, better icons' and referenced Cursor's dashboard as inspiration

preferences.value: Behavioral instructions must persist across AI platforms. Write them to the Standing Instructions section of the context file AND to brain/preferences.json so they survive platform switches.
preferences.learned_from: user said: 'how do we pass them into DevTrack accurately so that if I'm working in Cursor or Claude Code or Gemini CLI, it gets all the same instructions'

learned_patterns.pattern: User thinks in voice-note style — long stream-of-consciousness with multiple ideas. Capture each distinct idea separately.
learned_patterns.notes: Always parse multi-idea messages and log each one individually to ideas/items.json

learned_patterns.pattern: User wants to understand the tool's own workflow — how to use Now/Next/Later, when to move ideas to backlog, etc.
learned_patterns.notes: Should document the intended workflow clearly — probably in a dedicated view or onboarding flow

learned_patterns.pattern: User rapidly ideates during conversation — will share 5-10 ideas in one message, mixing business strategy, technical architecture, UX vision, and product direction. Each needs separate capture.
learned_patterns.notes: Session 4 had multiple messages with 3-6 distinct ideas each. All captured to IDEA-018 through IDEA-022. The user explicitly asked for audit because they know ideas get lost.

learned_patterns.pattern: User wants honest pushback, not agreement. Will directly ask 'do you actually agree with me or are you just saying that?'
learned_patterns.notes: Give genuine opinions with specific reasoning. Say where you agree AND where you'd push back. The user respects directness.
